model.cargo
Class CargoConnection

java.lang.Object
  model.cargo.CargoConnection

public class CargoConnection
extends java.lang.Object

This class createts and manages the Cargo Database Connection, it links with the Cargo Database Soap Service and sets a connection to be used by the simulator This class will give errors of the database service is not functioning properly

Version:
april 2010
Author:
Jorge Alexis Hernandez

Method Summary
 void closeConnection()
          Closes the Cargo Connection, this method must be called whenever the application is exited or a hard reset is called
 java.util.List<Event> getEvents(int scenario)
          This method obtains all the events associated with a specific EventScenario from the database, it then creates the events stores them in a list and returns the list.
 java.util.List getRoutes()
          Obtains The routes and data associated to routes to be used while filling the route pool in the simulator PoolBoy Obtains the data from the database creates Route objects and returns a list containing these objects
 void initConnection()
          Initializes the cargo database service connection, this method must be called first in order to use the database within the simulator via a CargoConnection

Constructor Detail

CargoConnection

public CargoConnection()
Method Detail

initConnection

public void initConnection()
Initializes the cargo database service connection, this method must be called first in order to use the database within the simulator via a CargoConnection

closeConnection

public void closeConnection()
Closes the Cargo Connection, this method must be called whenever the application is exited or a hard reset is called

populate

public java.util.List populate()
This method obtains the trips from the database, these trips contain most of the data pertaining drivers, trucks and similar data. This method should be used to populate trips in the simulator and all relevant data. it is set to obtain 100 trips by default. This class generates a list of Trips

Returns:
a list containing the Trips obtained from the database

getRoutes

public java.util.List getRoutes()
Obtains The routes and data associated to routes to be used while filling the route pool in the simulator PoolBoy Obtains the data from the database creates Route objects and returns a list containing these objects

Returns:
a list containing the Routes obtained from the database

getEvents

public java.util.List<Event> getEvents(int scenario)
This method obtains all the events associated with a specific EventScenario from the database, it then creates the events stores them in a list and returns the list. This method should be called when setting up the Event Handler

Parameters:
scenario - the id number for a specific Scenario to be queried
Returns:
a List of Events that makes up the requested Scenario

setEventSessionID

public void setEventSessionID(int sessionID)
Updates the EventSessionID in the databse

Parameters:
sessionID - new session id

test

public void test()
